intro: Zygophlebia, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with both male and female flowers, typical of the Moraceae family. Zygophlebia species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing on rocky substrates. The fruit is a small, fig-like structure that is edible and serves as a food source for various animals.
